meanings.definition: Of or relating to the sense of touch.
meanings.sent1: The soft blanket was tactual, inviting a cozy feeling.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the tactual experience of running her fingers through the sand.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy's tactual exploration of the mud left paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His tactual memory of her touch lingered long after she was gone.
meanings.sent5: The tactual sensation of the warm sun on his skin was comforting.

meanings.sent1: The rough texture of the tree bark made it tactual to anyone who felt it.
meanings.sent2: The tactual feedback from the buttons confirmed the device was working.
meanings.sent3: The chef's tactual assessment of the dough ensured it was ready to be baked.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, it felt almost tactual.
meanings.sent5: The tactual presence of the mountain loomed large in the distance.
